links.title: Swing Trading Weekly Review - June 3rd.
links.description: The S&P 500 gained 0.3% last week. A week of strong declines following Italy's debt and the trade war ended slightly higher on better-than-expected employment data released on Friday. In the past nine years, the bulls have learned that every pullback needs to be bought and despite the pessimism of the bears, it succeeded this week again.

links.description: One of the biggest days of the year is coming up for Apple Inc. ( AAPL) watchers and fans. links.title: Dow Jones Futures: Apple, Palo Alto Neworks, Merck, Loxo Oncology
links.description: Dow Jones futures fell slightly vs. fair value Sunday, along with S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures, as weekend U.S.-China trade talks ended with little progress. Apple ( AAPL) holds its Worldwide Developers Conference starting Monday. Palo Alto Neworks ( PANW), HealthEquity ( HQY), and Coupa Software ( COUP) report quarterly earnings Monday.

links.title: Palo Alto Networks Earnings Preview
links.description: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) reports earnings Monday June 4th after the close. It's beaten earnings the past 5 quarters. It beats EPS estimates by 14.3% on average. The stock goes up 9.7%, on average, after reporting earnings. On Wednesday June 6th, Nikesh Arora will become the new CEO of Palo Alto Networks.

links.title: Apple (AAPL) Stock Analysis - Dividend Value Builder
links.description: Apple's iPhone and iOS operating system are known for their quality, security, and integration abilities. These are the backbone of a successful product lineup and have given Apple the ability to obtain premium prices (high profit margins) for their favored brand. Apple has a competitive advantage because of its sheer size and ability to vertically integrate.
